00120 #include <avr32/io.h>
00121 #include "compiler.h"
00122 #include "gpio.h"
00123 #include "pm.h"
00124 #include "board.h"
00125 #include "eic.h"
00126 #include "intc.h"
00127 
00128 
00136 
00137 #if BOARD==EVK1100
00138 #define SCAN_COL1_IDX   0   
00139 #define SCAN_COL2_IDX   1   
00140 #elif BOARD==EVK1101
00141 #define SCAN_COL1_IDX   4   
00142 #define SCAN_COL2_IDX   5   
00143 #endif
00145 
00146 
00149 
00150 // With the datasheet, in section "Peripheral Multiplexing on I/O lines" in the
00151 // table "GPIO Controller Function Multiplexing", 
00152 // For UC3A part, linked to EVK1100 board, we see that PA08 and PA10 are
00153 // multiplexed with respectively EXTINT lines 7 and 6. PA25 and PA26 are respectively
00154 // multiplexed with respectively SCAN lines 1 and 2.
00155 // Note: PA08, PA10, PA25 and PA26 are available on extension connectors
00156 #if BOARD==EVK1100
00157 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_PIN_LINE1               AVR32_EIC_EXTINT_6_PIN
00158 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_FUNCTION_LINE1          AVR32_EIC_EXTINT_6_FUNCTION
00159 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_LINE1                   EXT_INT6
00160 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_IRQ_LINE1               AVR32_EIC_EIC_IRQ_6
00161 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_PIN_LINE2               AVR32_EIC_EXTINT_7_PIN
00162 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_FUNCTION_LINE2          AVR32_EIC_EXTINT_7_FUNCTION
00163 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_LINE2                   EXT_INT7
00164 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_IRQ_LINE2               AVR32_EIC_EIC_IRQ_7
00165 // For UC3B part, linked to EVK1101 board, we see that PB2 and PB3 are 
00166 // multiplexed with EXTINT lines 6 and 7, and PB6 and PB7 with SCAN lines 4 and 5
00167 // Note: PB2, PB3, PB6 and PB7 are available on extension connectors
00168 #elif BOARD==EVK1101
00169 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_PIN_LINE1               AVR32_EIC_EXTINT_6_PIN
00170 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_FUNCTION_LINE1          AVR32_EIC_EXTINT_6_FUNCTION
00171 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_LINE1                   EXT_INT6
00172 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_IRQ_LINE1               AVR32_EIC_EIC_IRQ_6
00173 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_PIN_LINE2               AVR32_EIC_EXTINT_7_PIN
00174 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_FUNCTION_LINE2          AVR32_EIC_EXTINT_7_FUNCTION
00175 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_LINE2                   EXT_INT7
00176 #define EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_IRQ_LINE2               AVR32_EIC_EIC_IRQ_7
00177 #endif
00178 #define EXT_SCAN_EXAMPLE_PIN_LINE1              ATPASTE3(AVR32_EIC_SCAN_,SCAN_COL1_IDX,_PIN)
00179 #define EXT_SCAN_EXAMPLE_FUNCTION_LINE1         ATPASTE3(AVR32_EIC_SCAN_,SCAN_COL1_IDX,_FUNCTION)
00180 #define EXT_SCAN_EXAMPLE_PIN_LINE2              ATPASTE3(AVR32_EIC_SCAN_,SCAN_COL2_IDX,_PIN)
00181 #define EXT_SCAN_EXAMPLE_FUNCTION_LINE2         ATPASTE3(AVR32_EIC_SCAN_,SCAN_COL2_IDX,_FUNCTION)
00183 
00184 
00186 eic_options_t eic_options[2];
00187 
00189 unsigned char key_number = 0;
00190 
00191 
00195 #if __GNUC__
00196 __attribute__((__interrupt__))
00197 #elif __ICCAVR32__
00198 __interrupt
00199 #endif
00200 static void eic_int_handler1(void)
00201 {
00202   int line_number;
00203   line_number = eic_get_interrupt_pad_scan(&AVR32_EIC);
00204   switch(line_number)
00205   {
00206   case SCAN_COL1_IDX :
00207     key_number = 1;
00208     break;
00209   case SCAN_COL2_IDX :
00210     key_number = 2;
00211     break;
00212   }
00213   eic_clear_interrupt_line(&AVR32_EIC, EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_LINE1);
00214 }
00215 
00216 
00220 #if __GNUC__
00221 __attribute__((__interrupt__))
00222 #elif __ICCAVR32__
00223 __interrupt
00224 #endif
00225 static void eic_int_handler2(void)
00226 {
00227   int line_number;
00228   line_number = eic_get_interrupt_pad_scan(&AVR32_EIC);
00229   switch(line_number)
00230   {
00231   case SCAN_COL1_IDX :
00232     key_number = 3;
00233     break;
00234   case SCAN_COL2_IDX :
00235     key_number = 4;
00236     break;
00237   }
00238   eic_clear_interrupt_line(&AVR32_EIC, EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_LINE2);
00239 }
00240 
00241 
00242 /* \brief Software delay
00243  *
00244  */
00245 static void software_delay(void)
00246 {
00247   int i;
00248   for (i=0; i<10000; i++);
00249 }
00250 
00251 
00252 /* 
00253  * \brief This is an example on how to use an external interrupt and to generate
00254  * interrupt using SCAN lines.
00255  */
00256 int main(void)
00257 {
00258   // Enable edge-triggered interrupt.
00259   eic_options[0].eic_mode  = EIC_MODE_EDGE_TRIGGERED;
00260   // Interrupt will trigger on falling edge (this is a must-do for the keypad scan
00261   // feature if the chosen mode is edge-triggered).
00262   eic_options[0].eic_edge  = EIC_EDGE_FALLING_EDGE;
00263   // Initialize in synchronous mode : interrupt is synchronized to the clock
00264   eic_options[0].eic_async = EIC_SYNCH_MODE;
00265   // Set the interrupt line number.
00266   eic_options[0].eic_line  = EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_LINE1;
00267 
00268 
00269   // Enable edge-triggered interrupt.
00270   eic_options[1].eic_mode   = EIC_MODE_EDGE_TRIGGERED;
00271   // Interrupt will trigger on falling edge (this is a must-do for the keypad scan
00272   // feature if the chosen mode is edge-triggered).
00273   eic_options[1].eic_edge  = EIC_EDGE_FALLING_EDGE;
00274   // Initialize in synchronous mode : interrupt is synchronized to the clock
00275   eic_options[1].eic_async  = EIC_SYNCH_MODE;
00276   // Set the interrupt line number.
00277   eic_options[1].eic_line   = EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_LINE2;
00278 
00279   
00280   // Activate LED0 & LED1 & LED2 & LED3 pins in GPIO output mode and switch them off.
00281   gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED0_GPIO);
00282   gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED1_GPIO);
00283   gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED2_GPIO);
00284   gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED3_GPIO);
00285  
00286   // Map the interrupt lines to the GPIO pins with the right peripheral functions.
00287   static const gpio_map_t EIC_GPIO_MAP =
00288   {
00289     {EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_PIN_LINE1, EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_FUNCTION_LINE1},
00290     {EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_PIN_LINE2, EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_FUNCTION_LINE2},
00291     {EXT_SCAN_EXAMPLE_PIN_LINE1, EXT_SCAN_EXAMPLE_FUNCTION_LINE1},
00292     {EXT_SCAN_EXAMPLE_PIN_LINE2, EXT_SCAN_EXAMPLE_FUNCTION_LINE2}
00293   };
00294   gpio_enable_module(EIC_GPIO_MAP, sizeof(EIC_GPIO_MAP) / sizeof(EIC_GPIO_MAP[0]));
00295   // Enable GPIO pullups for the rows.
00296   gpio_enable_pin_pull_up(EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_PIN_LINE1);
00297   gpio_enable_pin_pull_up(EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_PIN_LINE2);
00298   
00299   // Disable all interrupts.
00300   Disable_global_interrupt();
00301 
00302   // Initialize interrupt vectors.
00303   INTC_init_interrupts();
00304 
00305   // Register the EIC interrupt handler to the interrupt controller.
00306   // eic_int_handler1 and eic_int_handler2 are the interrupt handlers to register.
00307   // EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_IRQ_LINE1 and EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_IRQ_LINE2 are the IRQ of the
00308   // interrupt handlers to register.
00309   // INT0 is the interrupt priority level to assign to the group of this IRQ.
00310   // void INTC_register_interrupt(__int_handler handler, unsigned int irq, unsigned int int_lev);
00311   INTC_register_interrupt(&eic_int_handler1, EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_IRQ_LINE1, INT0);
00312   INTC_register_interrupt(&eic_int_handler2, EXT_INT_EXAMPLE_IRQ_LINE2, INT0);
00313 
00314   // Init the EIC controller with the options
00315   eic_init(&AVR32_EIC, eic_options, 2);
00316   // Enable the EIC lines.
00317   eic_enable_lines(&AVR32_EIC, (1<<eic_options[1].eic_line)|(1<<eic_options[0].eic_line));
00318   // Enable the interrupt for each EIC line.
00319   eic_enable_interrupt_lines(&AVR32_EIC, (1<<eic_options[1].eic_line)|(1<<eic_options[0].eic_line));
00320   // Enable the keypad scanning feature and configure the scan rate to 18ms (== pow(2,(10+1))*RCOsc).
00321   eic_enable_interrupt_scan(&AVR32_EIC,10);
00322 
00323   // Enable all interrupts.
00324   Enable_global_interrupt();
00325 
00326 
00327   // Loop infinitely, toggling the leds depending on the latest pressed key.
00328   while(1)
00329   {
00330     switch (key_number)
00331     {
00332       case 1 :
00333         gpio_clr_gpio_pin(LED0_GPIO);
00334         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED1_GPIO);
00335         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED2_GPIO);
00336         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED3_GPIO);
00337         key_number = 0;
00338         software_delay();
00339         break;
00340       case 2 :
00341         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED0_GPIO);
00342         gpio_clr_gpio_pin(LED1_GPIO);
00343         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED2_GPIO);
00344         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED3_GPIO);
00345         key_number = 0;
00346         software_delay();
00347         break;
00348       case 3 :
00349         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED0_GPIO);
00350         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED1_GPIO);
00351         gpio_clr_gpio_pin(LED2_GPIO);
00352         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED3_GPIO);
00353         key_number = 0;
00354         software_delay();
00355         break;
00356       case 4 :
00357         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED0_GPIO);
00358         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED1_GPIO);
00359         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED2_GPIO);
00360         gpio_clr_gpio_pin(LED3_GPIO);
00361         key_number = 0;
00362         software_delay();
00363         break;
00364       default :
00365         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED0_GPIO);
00366         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED1_GPIO);
00367         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED2_GPIO);
00368         gpio_set_gpio_pin(LED3_GPIO);
00369         break;
00370     }
00371   }
00372 
00373 }
Generated on Thu Sep 20 12:12:48 2007 for AVR32 UC3 - EIC Driver Example 3 by  1.5.1-p1
